com.example.sip
Class ScholarSchoolActivity

java.lang.Object
  android.content.Context
      android.content.ContextWrapper
          android.view.ContextThemeWrapper
              android.app.Activity
                  com.example.sip.ScholarSchoolActivity
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory2, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback, android.widget.SeekBar.OnSeekBarChangeListener
public class ScholarSchoolActivity
extends android.app.Activity
implements android.widget.SeekBar.OnSeekBarChangeListener

This activity contains information for the Scholarships by Schools screen. Is connected to the scholar_schools_activity.xml file.

Author:
Loucas Stylianou

Method Detail

areBoundsOk

private boolean areBoundsOk()
Check the bounds if are ok. Lower bound cant be greater than or equal to the upper bound.

Returns:
True if everything is fine, false otherwise.

connectWidgets

private void connectWidgets()
Initialise the class fields with their corresponding value found in the xml file.

getCrimeList

public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getCrimeList(float low,
                                                           float max)
This method checks which boroughs fell into the given range of crime and store them in a list

Parameters:
low - Minimum level of crime rate selected by the user
max - Maximum level of crime rate selected by the user
Returns:
A list of boroughs' ids

getGcseList

public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getGcseList(float low,
                                                          float max)
This method checks which schools fell into the given range of gcse results and store them in a list

Parameters:
low - Minimum level of gcse results selected by the user
max - Maximum level of gcse results selected by the user
Returns:
A list of schools' ids

getMatchedList

private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getMatchedList(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> boroughList,
                                                              java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> gcseList)
This method finds schools that exists in the gcseList and the borough where they exist is also found in the boroughList

Parameters:
boroughList - A list with boroughs' ids, conjunction of the unemploymentList and crimeList
gcseList - A list of schools' ids according to the gcse criteria set by the user
Returns:
A list of schools' ids that is conjunction of both lists send as parameters

getUnempl_Crime_MatchedList

public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getUnempl_Crime_MatchedList(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> UnemploymentList,
                                                                          java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> crimeList)
This method find which boroughs' ids are stored both list: UnemploymentList and crimeList

Parameters:
UnemploymentList - A list of boroughs' ids according to the unemployment
crimeList - A list of boroughs' ids according to the crime
Returns:
A list of boroughs' ids which is a conjunction of UnemploymentList and crimeList.

noListIsEmpty

public boolean noListIsEmpty(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> UnemploymentList,
                             java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> CrimeList,
                             java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> GcseList)
Check if there exists an empty list and output error message

Parameters:
UnemploymentList - A list containing boroughs' ids according to the user's set criteria for unemployment rate
CrimeList - A list containing boroughs' ids according to the user's set criteria for crime rate
GcseList - A list containing schools' ids according to the user's set criteria for gcse average score
Returns:
True if there exists an empty list, false otherwise

onResume

public void onResume()
This method defines activities actions according to user 's interaction with it when is running. When the button ResultList is clicked by the user, check the bounds then check for empty lists and finally get the matchedList that is a conjunction of the three others: unemploymentList, crimeList, gcseList use merge sort to sort the list in descending order according gcse results, store the list in an intent and then start the SchoolListActivity.

Overrides:
onResume in class android.app.Activity

onStartTrackingTouch

public void onStartTrackingTouch(android.widget.SeekBar bar)
Do nothing

Specified by:
onStartTrackingTouch in interface android.widget.SeekBar.OnSeekBarChangeListener
